intro: Correlliana schlimii, commonly known as the Schlim's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States, particularly in Texas and New Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with five petals arranged in a bell shape. Correlliana schlimii is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral.
